intro: Fontainea australis, commonly known as the Australian fontainea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a slightly hairy texture. Fontainea australis thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and inland regions of southern Australia.
